skillTree.localised_description: Smaller than their powerful Bretonnian equivalents, barding protects Imperial warhorses from blows that would otherwise fell these proud beasts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: With its powerful clockwork mechanism, this bucking equine contraption can demolish most things that suffer the impact of being in its rider’s path.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Granted command of a Steam Tank, even an Engineer can dominate a battlefield, expertly striking the delicate balance of directing pressured steam between wheel-pistons and steam-belching weapons.

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

This unit has variable  Missile Block Chance depending on which side of the unit is hit by a projectile.
	
	The missile block chance of each direction is:
	 100% from the front
	 50% from the sides
	 10% from the rear
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: There is never a spare moment for a Master Engineer – any free time is spent buried in schematics diagrams in order to perfect their designs.

effects.description:
Global and Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Empire Artillery and War Machine units
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who bear the Mark of Hysh are practitioners of the magical Lore of Light, and the bane of Chaos, for they are able to control and manipulate the White Wind of Magic.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +10% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +30% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: An Engineer doesn't just make machines of war. Months of design and innovation have paid off, and now your navigators reap the benefit.
Arrows, cannonballs and more esoteric munitions – you can never have too many when the war never ends.
The machines of the Empire aren't immune to failure, but luckily with a Master Engineer nearby, they rarely stay broken for long.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Empire Artillery and War Machine units
	(Lord's army)

Casualty replenishment rate: +15% for Empire Artillery and War Machine units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Empire's Engineers know how best to calibrate their weapons for increased range.
Working with gunpowder takes alot of patience... one wrong move and you might lose your trigger finger... or more!
A Master Engineer's garments must be extremely resistant to both fire and ballistics, because if a failed experiment doesn't get them, the apparatus that comes flying at them afterwards surely will!
A true master knows there is more than one way to defeat your enemies. Being thrown off your feat by a nearby blast is enough to leave many disorientated, deaf and defenceless.

effects.description: Enables "Dazed" contact effect (reduced Speed and Melee Defence)

skillTree.localised_description: What better way to increase your firepower than with.. fire?! These firebombs will set ablaze all who survive the initial blast.

effects.description: Upgrade Grenade Launchers to Firebomb Grenade Launchers (shots leave fire patch on the ground for a short duration)

skillTree.localised_description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
If a Master Engineer wants something, he'll get it. Quartermasters can rarely refuse a demanding Guild engineer.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
What use armour, or even magical defences, against such powerful ordnance?
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A clever arrangement of lenses makes the target seem just that bit closer.
Death is always just a shot away.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Sigmarite Disciples and Halberdiers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."
